post.summary: Create a trigger-event, trigger-event provides a webhook for triggering a specified workflow.
post.description: Create a trigger-event entity. The trigger-event entity is used for triggering a workflow (using account context as 'namespace' and {project}/{pipeline} as name). This entity has an endpoint field that holds the trigger's webhook

example.help:
Docker Hub webhooks fire when an image is built in, pushed or a new tag is added to, your repository.

Configure Docker Hub on https://hub.docker.com/r/mydhuccount/hello/~/settings/webhooks/

Add following Codefresh Docker Hub webhook endpoint https://g.codefresh.io/nomios/dockerhub?account=1e88****&secret=sBdW****

Docker Hub webhooks fire when an image is built in, pushed or a new tag is added to, your repository.

Configure Docker Hub on https://hub.docker.com/r/mydhuccount/ui-api/~/settings/webhooks/

Add following Codefresh Docker Hub webhook endpoint https://g.codefresh.io/nomios/dockerhub?account=1e88****&secret=Tg2D****

Cronus cron event provider triggers Codefresh pipeline execution, following cron expression.
Supported cron expression syntax:
https://github.com/codefresh-io/cronus/blob/master/docs/expression.md

JFrog Artifactory webhooks fire when an image is built in, pushed or a new tag is added to, your repository.

Configure JFrog Artifactory on https://codefresh.io/docs/docs/configure-ci-cd-pipeline/triggers/jfrog-triggers/

Add following Codefresh JFrog Artifactory webhook endpoint https://g.codefresh.io/nomios/helm/jfrog?account=2cf1fed*****&secret=5X6iv9a******

metadata.name: simple/hello
metadata.originalYamlString:
# More examples of Codefresh YAML can be found at
# https://codefresh.io/docs/docs/yaml-examples/examples/

version: "1.0"
# Stages can help you organize your steps in stages
stages:
  - "clone"
  - "build"
  - "test"

steps:
   Freestyle:
     title: Running docker image
     type: freestyle
     working_directory: '.'
     arguments:
       image: 'alpine'
       commands:
         - echo "fdfdffd"
         - ls -ltr
         - echo $(pwd)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Optional offset, i.e, ?offset=1&limit=1 would retrieve the second pipeline in the results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: optional limit=2, for limit number of pipelines in response

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: optional labels to filter results by.

post.description: Create a pipeline in the user's account, for updating existing pipeline use the replace: PUT /pipelines/$NAME

preventProgressBlinkingFlag.description: Fix bug with blinking progress component after build restart

executionContextFeature.description: UI Execution Context page in the account settings

redirectFromSuspendedToDefault.description: If account is suspended - redirect to not suspended account

usersManagementV2.description: user management page rewritten on angular 2
